Name: Freedom Rings
Description:
Freedom Rings is a game based on the idea that an economy is a community that can be free and fair to all. The richest don’t always win and victory is what you choose it to be. The game board is inspired by a thriving city; with the greatest land values in its heart, medium land values in the suburbs, and the lowest land values in the rural areas. Freedom Rings’ blends economics, ease of play, and short time to finish.

Each player receives the 7 goal cards and chooses a single goal card to secretly play.  The game is played with the 3 playing pieces, one for each of the three property rings. Before each turn, the player must choose which ring to play. The first time a player plays a ring, if it’s with a die roll, the playing piece starts at the Pay Interest Street.  The playing pieces move clockwise around the board. Every turn, except for the first turn and power plays, requires a die roll. The die roll isn’t to determine what property you claim, but to keep players moving around the board and to see if rent is due to another player.

When the game begins, all players have no money, no property, and no debt. Acquiring property is the way for a player to achieve their goal. The community is the bank, so players will volunteer to watch the flows of cash and debt as needed. Turn by turn, players accumulate properties. Tactics to win can include the following: acquiring properties after a die roll, purchasing other property, consolidating properties, trading acquired property for vacant property trading with other players.  Other tactics become available as the game’s economy grows and include earning the ability to change production point values, interest rates, and even your chosen goal. Only the wiliest will make the most of what is freely given in this game.

A player wins by achieving a goal chosen from seven goal cards available. Victory can be had with much wealth, or little wealth,  depending upon the chosen card. Players claim property squares on the board with every turn until they’ve acquired what’s needed as stated on their chosen goal card. Final scoring is calculated with the value for each property square, less the player’s debt.

Name: Gather Your Party: Tavern Edition
Description:
Gather Your Party  is a 2-4 player tavern party game where you and your friends compete to gain the most Reputation in the tavern. Recruit Patrons, Send Drink Tokens, Complete Quests and avoid all perils of a night out at the tavern.

To win, players will have to manage how much Reputation they have, and how much they Drink.

Get four (4) Reputation, win the game. Get four (4) Drink tokens, get knocked out.

Players will take turns adding Patrons to their parties, completing Quests and avoid getting too drunk. Once you gain enough Reputation from completing Quests, you become a Drinking Legend and win the game.

Alternatively, you can drink your friends under-the-table and become the last player standing. There are many different Patrons and Events cards that give and take away Drinks, but essentially, if you hit your limit of 4 Drink Tokens, you are knocked out of the game.

Name: Terminus Frontier
Description:
Terminus Frontier is a cooperative adventure game for 1-4 players featuring tactical squad combat missions, impactful narrative choices, and open-world space exploration.

Take on the role of a Drift Hunter, an elite vigilante and soldier of fortune!  Travel the stars collecting bounties on wanted fugitives and performing contracts for competing stellar factions. Your squad will perform heists on maximum-security compounds, engage in deadly firefights with xeno kill teams, and fly to the uncharted reaches of deep space on their mission for fortune and glory. You will be forced to make difficult decisions and face treacherous betrayals as you do business with the notorious denizens of the outer planets.

Take the helm of your ship and prepare to discover your destiny among the stars! Experience over 60 hours of game play in this massive space odyssey! Progress along a persistent story campaign over multiple sessions, unlocking new secret content that can only be discovered by the choices you make along the way.  Your progress is easily saved between sessions.

Terminus Frontier features scenario-based missions. Players win by completing the scenario objectives (rescue the hostages, survive 4 turns, breach the door, etc). At the start of each round, the players will decide on their activation order (called Squad Formation). This determines that player's Initiative and Action Points. On a player's activation, that player can play Skill Cards from their hand to perform actions (move, shoot, melee, etc) or equip permanents into play. Combat is resolved using our dice-less Dual Weapon Ammo Deck system.

Name: Jewish Card Revoked
Description:
Every round, players read aloud a card with subjective questions about Jewish culture such as "What's the most stereotypical sign of Jewish neuroticism?" and "What topic do you dread discussing with your relatives but know will come up?" Everyone holds up their A,B, C, or D voting cards to vote on their favorite answer.

Then someone from the majority opinion and each minority opinion gets 45 seconds or less to defend their answer. A re-vote occurs to see if anyone was convinced, and the answer is majority rule. Players all start with 10 points, and every time they disagree with the majority, they get a point deducted. The next round, players dive into another humorous question about Jewish culture or religion.

The player with the most points wins.

Name: Operation RI
Description:
Operation RI is a print and play wargame of moderate complexity for one or two players, simulating the Japanese overland advance on Port Moresby in 1942 and the subsequent Allied counter-offensive.

Components (need to be printed, the counters require assembly):

Rulebook

Charts and tables

Set up cards

2 x maps (recommended print size 11" x 17" each)

1 x half sheet of double-sided unit counters and markers (74 combat units and 12 markers)

1 x half sheet of double-sided strength markers (88 strength markers)

Historical background and designer's notes

Comprehensive and illustrated examples of play

Scale: battalion and company

Map: point-to-point movement

Time frame: weekly turns

Solitaire suitability: very high

Design features: battle fatigue, jungle and mountain warfare, Allied air transport, Japanese bunker defences.

The Japanese have a chance to capture Port Moresby via the overland route using their seasoned infantry from the South Seas Force. The terrain will make it a difficult task. If they fail, the Allied forces will launch a counter-attack with the aim of driving the Japanese into the sea.

The system focuses on the effect prolonged periods of combat in difficult terrain had on combat units. Units which fight for too long without respite are vulnerable to counter-attack. Each side must manage their forces with respect to fatigue, which represents combat exhaustion and ammunition expenditure, and the inherent logistical difficulties this campaign posed.

Can the Japanese capture Port Moresby? In this simulation they can, but it is difficult.

Also challenging is the task of crushing the Japanese beachheads on the north coast.

Purchase via direct digital download at : https://www.wargamevault.com/product/379181/Operation-RI?src=hottest

Name: Звёздные империи: Гамбит (Star Realms: Gambit)
Description:
This compilation includes five expansions:

Crisis – Bases & Battleships
Crisis – Heroes
Crisis – Events
Crisis – Fleets & Fortresses
2014 Gen Con Gambit Set (with 20 cards)

Name: Conveyor Rummy
Description:
Conveyor Rummy is a Rummy-style game for 2-4 players played entirely with dominoes.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their dominoes by playing melds of runs and sums.

The game requires either a double-9 or a double-12 domino set to be played.

Name: Cardfrontation
Description:
In the taberns of Aguacatata, mercenaries play a unique card game: Cardfrontation!

Each player controls two pawns. Move them to gather resources and craft weapons, equip these weapons on the left or right hand an attack your opponent to bring their life to 0!

Cardfrontation is a position based and resource management card combat game where two players compete in order to do the maximum damage to the opponent. Use strong weapons, powerful staff and tricky artifacts to win in this strategy driven game.

Name: Improving Games: Battleship
Description:
The Battleship cards were called "Fixing Other Games" cards, and I don't think that's the perfect title. We're not trying to make them better (although many will say that games like these need to be better), we're just trying to craft a different experience.

The Battleship cards, while tiny and dark, they make the game less of a seek and find and more of a seek and learn. And the Captains cut the length while giving cool bonus abilities.  Just a few small changes, but a very different experience.

Name: Rush M.D.: The Kickstarter Promos 2
Description:
Stretch goals that were reached during the 2020 Rush M.D. ICU Expansion Kickstarter campaign and consists of:


     105 Cards 
         6 Urinalysis Diagnosis Cards
         10 Scenario Cards
         4 Hospitalized Patient Cards
         Patient, Diagnosis, ECG Cards
    
     1 3D Cardboard Helicopter 
     10 Cardboard Tokens 
     1 Die 
     1 Rulebook

Name: Improving Games: Monopoly
Description: We had 4 Monopoly role cards to spice up everyone's favorite game (haha). Each has a whole bunch of new things going on. They have a special die roll, a starting corner / dollar amount, a special color where they gain extra money, and a big crazy special ability.

Name: Rush M.D.: Campaign Mode
Description:
With Rush M.D. - Campaign Mode you will be able to play a series of interconnected scenarios of Rush M.D., reliving the memories of a young medical intern.

Stretch goals that were reached during the 2020 Rush M.D. ICU Expansion Kickstarter campaign and consists of: 

     1 Hourglass
     1 Die
     12 Cards
     1 Board 
     25 Cardboard Tokens 
     2 Cardboard Tiles
     1 Booklet

Name: El Foc de la Gleva
Description:
El Foc de la Gleva (The Clash at La Gleva) is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design. It’s a 2-player game recreating a small clash during the Third Carlist War in Catalonia, around the city of Vic, in March 23rd, 1873.

With a mechanics similar to the "Storm over..." series, the Liberal player must clear the road from Vic to the barracks of Conanglell, while the Carlist player must pass at least two units to the city of Vic. Otherwise, victory is checked tallying Victory Points for occupied areas.

During six turns, players alternate activations of units in an area for movement or for combat, until all units have been activated or both players pass. Then a new turn begins.

Name: Improving Games: Scrabble
Description: We made a cool little Scrabble variant that plays both competitively and cooperatively. I don't know if Bananagrams have points on their letters, but if they do, this would be great to slip inside that little banana case. Either way, you can challenge other players and press you luck with larger destination tiles, or you can lead your friends along to words that may be within reach. We also included our simple fix / rule change about using up to 1 blank (upside down) tile in a word. Other words can share the blank but the same blank replacement letter must work for both words.

Name: Hostile Hoarders
Description:
The nuclear apocalypse has struck, leaving the world's culinary supply in shambles. Choose a Survivor to battle it out for new nuclear delicacies while wielding hilarious makeshift weapons fueled with ridiculous visual puns to combat your opponents.
 Hostile Hoarders is a game of war and self preservation for 2-5 players. Each survivor plays 4 weapon cards face down in front of them. Choose from one of your attacking weapon cards and pair it with an opponent's defending weapon card. Compare your attacking power to their defending power. The winner of the battle has prevailed and collects their reward. If the attacking player has conquered, they receive a meal that day, collecting one ration card. If the defender has bested the battle, they flip their defending weapon back face down and steal thee attacker’s weapon for their own, adding it to their hand.

Various instants can be added to aid in the skirmish.
When you have depleted all of your fellow survivor’s defense, go in for the kill. Attack a player with no facedown cards in front of them, and collect their survivor card as a reward. No food, only glory. When all other survivors are eliminated or a player has collected 10 ration points, you are the glutton of the apocalypse.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zip Zap Zop
Description:
Zip Zap Zop is a unique combination of deck-building and trick-taking that allows players to play a trick-taking game where they decide what cards they get dealt. This new concept gives the agency and strategy of a deck-building game, while maintaining the quick-paced, tactical nature of a trick-taking game.

The theme is integrated throughout, with players taking on the role of comedians in an improv show. The card play has the players interacting with each other in an improv scene and the new cards they buy are suggestions from the audience for the next scene.

Zip Zap Zop’s trick-taking follows the rules of a standard trick-taker, with a few differences:


     You may be able to play more than 1 card to the trick.
     Some cards are modifiers that modify a played card.
     If a player ever plays the same number as the previous card, then that player may play an additional card to the trick. The played cards then add, forming a new number.
     After playing tricks, players will buy cards using the number of tricks they won as currency.

Name: All About Altoona
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Altoona, PA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary

Name: All About Atlanta
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Atlanta, GA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary

Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Birmingham, AL depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary

Name: All About Boulder
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Boulder, CO depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary

Name: All About Cincinnati
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Cincinnati, OH depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary

Name: Friends Wicked Wango Quiz
Description:
A trivia game inspired by the TV series FRIENDS. You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut, through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey. You yank his tail and BOOM! You're in Paradice Pond!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pokémon Scratchees: The Ultimate Test
Description:
Pokémon battle arena game with fighting, rocks, ground, and water Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off challenge spaces revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, et. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card. For example, a duel icon means that you will face off against your opponent in the arena. Each player scratches a space and scores points based on how close the icon is to the player's own power type. The first to reach 25 points is the winner. If all the spaces are scratched off before that happens, the player with the most points is the winner.

In solo mode, the player plays both sides to see who wins. There are 8 scratchee cards in the box.

Name: Pokémon Scratchees:  The Flame Pokémon-athon
Description:
Pokémon racing game with flying, dragons, fire, electric, and bug Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off a square on the track, revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, etc. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card and potentially score points. Whoever collects the most points wins the game.

For solo games, the player plays both sides until a winner is determined.

Name: SmasHockey
Description:
The aim of the game is to score the most points by sending the puck into the opponent's goal.

Played facing each other, two players alternately hit the wooden puck with their mini hockey stick. A game is played in 3 rounds and the round ends when one player has accumulated 7 points. Each goal is worth 1 point

Name: Tiki Toss: Adventure Island
Description:
Tiki Toss: Adventure Island is a tropical tiki themed dexterity game combined with a traditional roll and move game in which up to 6 players race to be the first to return to the starting point after collecting a set of 5 different colored ring cards. Players earn ring cards at launching pad locations spread across the board. Once at one of these locations, players draw a corresponding ring card and successfully complete all instructions listed on the card. This usually requires players to make one or more successful tiki tosses. A tiki toss consists of a player swinging a metal ring, so that it catches on a hook attached to a tiki pole in the middle of the game board. As players move along paths to and from the different Launching Pads, they will encounter tiki heads that may help or hinder their progress.

—user summary

Your Village is in trouble with the Tiki Forces that be!  They are angry and demand 5 Precious Rings in order to spare the Village.  Two to Six Villagers are chosen to brave the dangers of Tiki Toss Adventure Island but there can only be one Hero! Can you be the first to collect the five rings (Gold, Silver, Ruby, Emerald, Coral) and return them to the village?

In order to collect the 5 rings, Players must embark on a journey through Quicksand Beach, The Isle of Fire, The Fourth Sister, The Ghost of the Galleon and Head Hunter Hill.  Along the way, Tiki Toss skills are essential! Although each player must beware of Sirens, Eruptions, being sentenced to the Pit and more, the biggest challenges can come from an opponent! You may be skipped, reversed or have a ring stolen by an opponent at any time! Trust no one. The stakes are high and the race back to the Village is on!

To be the Hero requires a balance of Luck and Skill!  The Dice may be on your side and you may draw the right cards, but do you have the skills of a Tiki Toss Master? Can you handle the pressure?

—description from the publisher

Name: Suipi
Description:
Suipi is a classic Samoan card game played using a standard deck of cards, similar in play to "Casino" or "Scopa".

Play starts with four cards being laid face up in the middle of the table, and eight cards being dealt to each player. The goal of the game is to capture the most points by matching cards and building stacks of cards. While regional rules may slightly alter how the game is played, some standard rules apply.

To gather a card from the table, players play a card from their hand which matches a table card in number, or matches the sum of two table cards (if the player has a 9 in their hand, they can gather a 5 and 4 from the table for example). Additionally, cards can be stacked (built) and taken as a stack on the next turn, but only if the player has the stacked number in their hand (for example, a 7 could be built onto a 3 to create a 10, allowing a player with a 10 in their hand to gather the whole stack on their turn). Face cards have no value and can only be gathered using matching face cards.

Additionally, if a player plays a card which matches several cards, stacks, or sums of individual cards on the table, the player may take all those cards. For example, if a player plays a 10 and there is on the table a 10, a stack of 3 & 7, and individually a 6 and 4 the player may take all of those cards as their 10 matches the first individual card, the total stack number, and the sum of the individual 6 and 4 cards.

If a player can not gather a card, they must 'drop' a card onto the table from their hand. If all cards are removed from the table, the player who removed the last card immediately scores 1 point and proclaims 'Suipi!'. The other player must then drop a card to continue the round. "Suipi" is played over 3 rounds, with each round ending when both player's hands are exhausted. Cards on the table remain there between rounds. At the end of the 3rd round, when cards run out of players hands', any cards remaining on the table go to the player which completed the most recent match.

Points are scored per round as follows:
Most cards = 3 points
10 of Diamonds = 2 points
2 of Spades = 1 point
Most Spades = 1 point
Aces = 1 point each
Each Suipi = 1 point (scored during the rounds)


     Note: depending on the village the game is learned in, scoring may be slightly different

Name: Plushie Pier
Description:
What does it take to be a victorious vendor of Plushie Pier? Selling lots of plushie sets, letting buyers haggle a bit, and boosting POMP! POMP is a local acronym for “place On My Pier.” It basically reflects the popularity, charisma, and overall esteem of your Craft.

Using the cards overlapping mechanic, player for prices of plushies on the pier for sale.
Each time you make a sale, you get a score card matching the icon and quantity of that set. If a player has sold their 8th Plushie, players complete the final round and score.

—description from the designer

Name: Horror Trivia Part II: Deeper Cuts
Description:
150 game cards, each featuring two horror film trivia questions (with answers on the back) and one of five weapon icons in the corner.

A trivia question is read from the card and the currently active team attempts to answer. If successful, the next question is read and they attempt to answer it also. If both answers were correct, they collect the card. Play passes to the next team.
The first team that collects 3 different weapons wins the game!

Name: 5 Second Rule: Disney Edition
Description: It should be easy to name 3 Disney dogs - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time's not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It's all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to "Just Spit It Out!"

Name: Things... Schitt's Creek
Description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

—description from the publisher

Name: Go Pop!: Hexo
Description: On a player's turn, they select a line and press down any number of bubbles on that line. The opponent then presses down any number of un-pressed bubbles in a line of their choice. The player left to press the last bubble on the board loses the round.

Name: Argy Bargey
Description:
Argy Bargey is a new board game where you compete to create your own canal empire.

Each player must complete routes between towns and cities, competing against each other. Using tiles, you'll want your waterway to take the fastest possible route across the board.

Just like real canals, you'll need to use locks and tunnels to tackle hills. Junctions will be needed to connect other canals and create an efficient network.

With an approximate playing time of 45 minutes, 2 to 6 people can gather to do battle - canal style! Can you become the greatest canal tycoon of the 21st century?

Name: Makrobrains
Description:
This game was made by wholesale store "Makro" (or "Metro" in Germany) for their 25 year anniversary in the Netherlands. You play this trivia game with 2 to 4 teams of each 2 to 4 players in it. Every team put their pawn (a brain) on the start position. The first team to reach the finish wins.

During your turn you will pick the top card from the pile. On each card there are 2 themes, one on each side of the card, and you have 10 seconds to decide which side you want to play.

After choosing the side you want to play, you get 60 seconds to guess the words written on the card which belong to the theme on the top of the card (Dutch writers, capital cities, Makro employer titles, types of cheese). The team to the right of the playing team is the control team, which tallies how many correct answers are given.

The answers are written on the card but have a red coating over them which makes them almost invisible to read, the game also features a pair of sunglasses with red-tainted glasses which can see through the coating and can read the correct answers (this pair of sunglasses is for the control team).

If no correct answer is given in the first 30 seconds, the first answer is given by the control team as a hint, this answer does not count towards the score. After the 60 seconds are over, the playing team moves their pawn as many spots as their score and then the control team becomes the new playing team.

Furthermore, some spots on the board have a special action like "Go back 3 spots", which goes into effect immediately when a team lands on it, or "if you can at least 5 correct answers next turn, move one extra spot forward" or "Lose a turn", which goes into effect on their next turn. The board has 48 spaces, including the start and the finish space.

Name: Spel van het Jaar 1996
Description:
In this game, each team/players tries to collect the 5 different coloured chips in the game which correspond to the questions on the quiz cards.

All questions are questions about what happened in the Netherlands and the World between October 1995 and October 1996.

The player/teams who rolls the black side of the die starts the game.
On a team/player's turn, they roll the die (yellow, red, purple, blue, green and black).
If they roll the black side, their turn is forfeited.
Otherwise, they have to answer the question on the quiz card which corresponds to the colour they rolled.
Is their answer correct, they gain the chip in that colour.
Is their answer incorrect, the turn goes to the next player.
If a team/player rolls a colour they already have a chip in, they have to answer the question connected to that colour and if they are correct, they may roll again. (normally this isn't the case after a correct answer)
Their turn continues until they either roll the black side, when they answer a question incorrectly or when they obtain a new coloured chip.

Name: EUrotour
Description:
In this Trivia game about the European Union and its member states, players try to answer questions correctly in order to continue their turn, but if they guess wrong, they might give their opponents an extra turn!

Every player starts on the starting spot.
The player who rolls the highest with the die starts the game.
In your turn, you roll the die and move that amount of places.
You can land on either: 

     a flag from a country, you then answer a question about the country who belongs to that flag
     a spot on the map of a country, you then answer a question about that country
     a Star, you then answer a question about the European Union


If you guess correctly, you get and extra turn and can roll again.
If you guess wrong, the next player can try to answer correctly, if any of the other players guess correctly, they save up an extra turn that they can use after their normal turn, but they do not move right now and the turn of the current player is over (unless they saved up an extra turn between their last turn and this one).
If no one answers the question correctly, the turn of the current player is over, unless that player has saved up extra turns between their last turn and this one.
You can save up at most 2 extra turns.

Questions from countries can be in their native language (Finnish, Swedish, Danish, English, German, French, Luxembourgian, Austrian) or they are in Dutch.

When a player reaches or goes over the finish spot, they have to answer one last question about the European Union to win the game. If they answer incorrectly they stay at their spot and get a new question about the European Union the next turn, if they guess correctly their next turn, they still win the game.

—user summary

Name: Mimikus
Description:
Each player receives a set of dice, which instead of points have faces in different expressions. The players roll all the dice and place them on the matching starting squares. A special die specifies which die faces may be moved in that round. This die is changed each round. The six different dice faces also offer action possibilities. The winner is the first to draw his 6 dice with different expressions onto the target fields.

—user summary

Name: All About Columbus, Georgia
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Columbus, GA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Town: Fall River, Massachusetts
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Fall River, MA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Long Beach
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Long Beach, CA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Montgomery
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Montgomery, AL depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: Schweine Roulette
Description: A roulette variant with pig motifs on the bidding cards and on the roulette wheel. Each player has 4 cards in hand, with one suit and one pig position, he can bid up to four suits. Then the wheel is spun, for the winning color with matching pig position there is a winning pig and the bet card, for the right color with wrong pig there is a triple chance card, for the wrong color and the right pig there is a single chance card, but you have to give up the bet cards. If nothing is right, you give away all the cards you have bet. Whoever has a winning pig can challenge another owner and bets on a pig position, if he turns the right one, he gets the opponent's pig, otherwise he loses his own to the opponent. The first to own three winning pigs wins.

Name: All About Philadelphia
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Philadelphia, PA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Town: Plymouth, Massachusetts
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Plymouth, MA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Portland
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Portland, ME depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: All About Waco
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Waco, TX depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: Das große Schlümpfe-Rennen
Description: In this running/dice game the Smurfs organize a race, each player chooses a figure, the Smurf cards are placed face down on the game board at the beginning. The player on the turn rolls the dice once and moves on by the number of dice rolled, whoever rolls a 6 may roll the dice again and move, foreign figures are skipped, there can be several figures on one field. At the end of the turn, you perform the event that belongs to the square you landed on - on some squares you get cards that bring you to Gargamel's castle or save you from it. The first player to get his figure back to the start/finish square is the winner.

Name: Geometric Emoji Cube
Description:
An educational building block game. There are 2 types of wooden cubes: 6 emoticon blocks (each side has a different cartoon expression) and 8 geometric blocks (each side has a different geometric pattern).

Each player starts out with their own set of the chosen cube type and the corresponding deck of puzzle pattern cards face down in a stack. Pick up a card and choose the correct combination of blocks to create the picture on the card. For the victory that takes the shortest amount of time, an hourglass can help keep time.

This is a great way for children to stimulate their attention, exercise fine motor skills, enhance their hand-eye coordination, spatial imagination, logical thinking ability, and practical abilities, and cultivate their hobbies. The cubes are painted with safe, non-toxic, water-based paint.

Name: Alfa Beta
Description:
Hooks are in the game, but the game has no hook, but works well! How? Well, you are supposed to fish for the most points and this happens with the longest words possible. In the game there are hooks with two ends, each hook carries a letter, the 74 orange hooks the common letters with value 1, the 14 green hooks the already somewhat more difficult letters with value 2 - B, F, G, H and K - and the 12 red hooks provide the problem cases with value 3 - C, J, P, Q, V, X, W and Z. The underlines on some hooks are wildcards for every other letter. The underscores on some hooks are wild cards for every other letter.

In turn, everyone thinks of a word, preferably with the reachable letters, takes the first letter from the pile, holds the hook vertically and fishes the next letter from the pile with the lower hook, until you have formed a valid word. The letters must be strung in the correct order and direction, otherwise the turn ends. If a letter falls from the hook, the turn also ends without points, letters are always put back. As I said, you can only use reachable letters and must not shuffle the pile. If you have a valid word, you keep it. If all letters are used up or no meaningful word is possible anymore, you win with the most points from the collected words.

A creative variation of the word-building games! Of course, it gets harder as more and more letters go out of play, but in return you may be able to form shorter but more valuable words as difficult letters are uncovered. Creativity, vocabulary and a steady hand are required and deliver fun!

Name: ホシゾラトリテ (Starry Sky Trick-Taking)
Description:
Starry Sky Trick-Taking is a 3-player only game in which the players draw constellations on a communal board based upon the cards played to a trick. The specific path(s) drawn are determined by the majority color played and the majority high/low numbers played, and the path is drawn by the winner of the trick.

Play continues until players have 1 card left in hand.  In addition to their traditional rank, the cards also show a bid number for how many points the drawn constellations will be worth. The winner of the game is the player whose bid was closest to the value of the constellations.

Name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim – The Adventure Game: 5-8 Player Expansion
Description:
Increase your party size in Free Roam! Bring up to 8 people to the table with this add-on which allows up to 8 players to participate in Free Roam modes.

Contains: 

     4 player boards
     extra player token sets
     30 cube tokens
     10 double-sided character cards
     9 custom dice
     4 game save boxes
     45 equipment cards


Note: while all Free Roam modes are compatible with this increase in players, the standard campaigns are not.

–description from the publisher
Families: Video Game Theme: The Elder Scrolls

Name: The Macomb School of Magic
Description:
Only you and your friends can save the Macomb Park District from the terrible Afflictions that have befallen the park. As the Afflictions have grown, brave magical houses have emerged to defend our precious parks. Choose your magical house, wield unique spells, visit our parks, Dispel the affliction and join the Macomb School of Magic!

A co-operative board game in which players visit local Macomb park locations, attempt to dispel negative afflictions with wild magic and ultimately collect the gem of each magical house and make a final stand against the affliction.

Name: Solarpunk Futures
Description:
Solarpunk Futures is a 10-minute rules-light role playing game where players imagine the pathways to a desirable world from the perspective of a utopian future.

Players use a deck of cards to remember Ancestors (e.g. grower, engineer, newcomer) and work together using Tools (e.g. recycled materials, equipment library, off-grid energy) and Values (e.g. care, responsibility, usufruct) to overcome a set of real-world Challenges (e.g. borders, ableist infrastructure, climate refugee crisis). Through dialogue and collaborative worldbuilding, collective and visionary narratives emerge of a new society, along with plausible scenarios for how to get there.

The players are guided through a collaborative storytelling process, imagining the pathway to their utopian future. In a conversation that can range from solemn to comical in tone, the players decide collectively how they worked together and why it took all of them to overcome the Challenge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Guts and Gory
Description:
They say the third time's the charm, but in this third expansion of Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar, there's precious little charm to be found . . .

The Gutbuster Mawtribe are obese, gluttonous, bloodthirsty ogors whose hunger for combat is as acute as their hunger for everything else. The Ossiarch Bonereapers are highly disciplined troops loyal to Nagash. You can serve them in life or serve them in death – they aren’t picky.

Contents: 112 cards in a tuckbox.

Name: Princess Heroes
Description:
Help the Princess Heroes race to the castle! The castle has been cursed and all of the princesses must get through the enchanted forest and make it to the castle before the last leaf from the tree of life lands on the ground. Work together to help the princesses defeat all the obstacles and make it to the castle before the leaf reaches the ground to break the curse.

In this cooperative game, kids ages 4+ will work together to help move all of the princess heroes across the board and into the castle. Players use their item cards to move a princess onto a matching space on the board. The princesses don’t share spaces, so players can get the princesses really moving by playing the same item card twice and jumping over the other princesses. Mixed into the item cards are obstacle cards. These obstacles take time to overcome and when a player draws an obstacle card, the leaf token falls one space closer to the ground. Players must get all of the princess heroes back to the castle before the leaf token reaches the ground and the castle curse cannot be broken.

The bright and colorful image-based gameplay makes Princess Heroes easy to learn and fun to play! Once players know the rules there is no reading required, which makes this a fun way for kids to use basic strategy skills and reduces competition by having the players work together to beat the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Baby Dinosaur Alphabet
Description:
Complete the dinosaurs and learn the alphabet by matching the two dinosaur halves together! The dinosaurs have been all mixed up, but you can help get them back together by matching the front and back half of the dinosaur by the image or by matching the first letter of the dinosaur type with the first letter of the dinosaur’s name.

Baby Dinosaur Alphabet is an easy to learn matching game for toddlers as young as two! With multiple ways to play, help kids learn image-based memory and matching skills, letter recognition, and the alphabet. Players start by spreading out the cards face down, and on their turn, they will flip over 2 cards. If the cards are a match, they set the pair aside. If the cards do not match, players will have to remember where they were and find the other matching pieces on their next turn! The player who creates the most matching pairs wins!

The colorful cards are a fun way to learn the alphabet and can help toddlers develop new skills. Kids can play on their own, against their friends, or cooperatively to match all the dinosaurs together!

-description from publisher

Name: My First Dragon Adventure
Description:
Race to the mountain top and convince the dragon to save the smore’s! The magical marshmallow fire in the kingdom has gone out, and it’s up to the heroes to race to the dragon’s nest and convince the dragon to help them relight the fire. Players move their hero through the lands collecting keys for hidden shortcuts and gems for the dragon, trying to be the first one to reach the dragon’s nest. Once players reach the nest, they will roll the dice and offer the dragon gems to convince them to come and help the kingdom.

In My First Dragon Adventure, kids will race through the different lands, using numbered cards to jump ahead, while trying to become the hero of the kingdom. But they better watch out! Along the way there are obstacles to avoid and gems to collect. Players move along the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Strategically use your cards to avoid landing on obstacles, pick up special items, and slow other players down. Once players reach the dragons nest, they roll the dice to see how the dragon will respond. The first player to make it to the nest and convince the dragon to help is the winner!

Colorful and detailed images make this story driven game a great way to help kids develop their strategic thinking and counting skills. Limited reading and basic counting make this an easy game for kids aged 5+ to learn and enjoy!

-description from publisher

Name: Vindication: Overgrowth Promo Pack
Description:
15 leafy new cards for Vindication with a deep forest theme.

 Companions: 

     ORENDA, THE NURTURING
     BOGDAN ROOTMAN
     KARA, THE WILD


 Traits: 

     NOSTALGIA
     ENTHUSIASM


 Relics: 

     THE SCRYING ANTLER
     INKWELL OF NATUREâ€™S SCRIBE
     MANA SPHEROID


 Pets: 

     BO, BURROWING BOULDER BOAR
     CAP, BABY MUSHROOM SPRITE


 Monsters: 

     AERIAL BEAKED BLIGHT
     SHADOWY TREE LURKER
     GIANT CAVE SNAIL


 Loot: 

     BULGING SEED POD
     NATUREâ€™S DEFENSE

Name: Ensnared
Description:
2-6 players take the roll of jungle animals learning the art of escape using the wisdom of their mentors. While hanging upside down in snares, players play oxygen sets or runs on themselves and blood sets or runs on an opponent.

When a player has played all of their cards, the player with more oxygen than blood is the master of escape.

—description from the designer

Name: The StarComm Wars
Description:
The StarComm Wars is a game of economic warfare simulating the Helion wars of 2312 to 2317. Players take on the roles of merchant companies and of the ill-fated Helion Imperium in an attempt to survive and prosper.

Two introductory scenarios introduce the merchant mechanics and how to play the Imperium. There is then one short and one full campaign scenario. The game is for 2-5 players, with one player representing the Imperium, against 1-4 merchants.

Name: Postcard Civil War East
Description:
Postcard Civil War East is a little postcard size/format Strategic  level board-wargame about the American Civil War in the East to mail/give to family & friends.
6 turns per year, 1861-65, but just a single year's campaign can be played.  7 Union and 5 Confederate pieces.  Lots of Fog of War, Jackson's Foot Cavalry II Corps while it lasts, etc.  A one-year campaign plays in ... 15 minutes? ... so the 5-year war (unless someone wins sooner) ... 75 minutes?
Simple, basic mechanics.

(Union player:) "Wherrre's Jackson?!"

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Skags at the Gates
Description:
Skags at the Gates gives you a wealth of new gameplay options. Includes:


     15 miniatures: 1x Skagzilla, 2x Alpha Skags, 2x Spitter Skags, 4x Adult Skags, 6x Skag Pups
     40+ game cards, including Skagzilla boss announcements and events.
     40 New arena hexes, 
     Big Game Hunt campaign book. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Zp9 "Abfahren!"
Description:
The trains start at the upper right corner (train depot). Movement is determined by a die. On an uneven roll the train has to follow the blue arrow, on an even roll the red arrows. On some spaces signals und signs affect movement. Naturally the trains can not pass each other on the tracks.

The first player to get his train to the destination station (below the depot) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: The Red Book of The Elf King Rules
Description:
This A4 softcover rulebook allows players to play a game which details the Elf Civil War, set in The Isles of Eas.

Contains full-colour illustrations, lore, & narratives from the Isles of Eas; with detailed rules, stats, & scenarios for every Circle and Wyrd Meeting within the Isles.

—description from the publisher (edited)

Name: Monopoly: Penrith Edition
Description: The traditional Monopoly board game but featuring locations from the Penrith area within the state of NSW, Australia.

Name: Khepri
Description:
The High Priest of the Order has passed away, after some good years of service, leaving the place vacant. Now the God-Emperor of Egypt must deliberate who will fill the position.

After a revealing dream, where the God-Emperor has a conversation with the God Khepri himself (Scarab God of Ancient Egypt), it is decided that the way of election must be by confronting the Priests to a battle of cunning and strategy that will leave one of them on top.

In Khepri, players play the role of an aspiring Priest of the Order of Khepri. The winner of the game will be elected the new High Priest.

Khepri is a board game for 2 to 4 PLAYERS, where there is no chance, therefore what prevails is strategy and logic. It is an abstract game where the number of players, per game, forces to change the strategy to win. Duration: 30 min. to 45 min.
The rules are very easy to learn, as they occupy only 1 sheet of paper. Three types of maneuvers, movement and how to score.

The game has been completely designed by Pere Martinez, who already has some other experience in this game world, such as Kao.
For the magnificent illustration of the box and the design of the board we have counted on Amy Kitsune.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Guca 3
Description: Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than). Modify the groups already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones, even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!

Name: Guca 5
Description:
Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than, additions/subtractions and equalities). Modify the groups that are already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!
A morea advanced version of Guca 3.

Name: The Second Book of The Elf King Troll Wars Rules
Description:
Writer of the cult hit The Red Book of The Elf King, Rick Priestley presents the first expansion to the game since its release! The Second Book of The Elf King explores the Outer Isles, with a whole new Campaign, leading to a Hellish conclusion. Players will rewrite the History of Eas in their wake. The game features a total of six new Circles being introduced into the game, alongside Scenario characters. and a vast new array of spell lists and rules adding on to the base game. Requires the first Book - The Red Book of The Elf King - to play.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shanzhai
Description:
Shanzhai is a fast playing pick-up and deliver, economic game in which you’re a “businessman” dealing counterfeit goods, trying to make more money than your rivals. Get deals from the local traders, complete them by selling the required goods, maybe gamble with the money you make and see if you’re lucky enough to double your income. You need to be fast and witty though, the more deals you complete the sooner the police come, will you bribe them or completely avoid them?

Shanzhai (Chinese: å±±å¯¨; pinyin: shÄnzhài) is a Chinese term that means counterfeit products.

—description from the designer

Name: Poppycock!
Description:
Bit of a boff or more of a blagger? Poppycock! is the hilarious trivia game that rewards big brains and mischievous mouths. Challenge friends and family as you Poppycock! your way through a series of quiz questions. Unsure of an answer but think you can get away with bluffing? Deceive your opponents until they shout out Poppycock! Clever meets crafty in this tactical game guaranteed to make you laugh out loud.

Choose a player to answer the first question. That player rolls the dice. The player to their right reads them the question from the category shown on the dice. If the dice is blank, the player answering the question may choose whichever category they want. The question, and multiple-choice answers, are read out, without the questioner turning over the card. The answering player must declare whether they know it or don’t know it. If they don’t know it, the turn ends, the questioner turns the card over and reads out the answer, and play continues clockwise. Discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player.

If they declare they know it, the player must declare how many spaces they are playing for. The player can declare 1, 2, or 3 spaces. This represents how many spaces they will be allowed to move if they get the answer right, or if no one challenges their answer. Additionally, this number represents the number of spaces other players will be allowed to move if they correctly Poppycock! the player answering the question (i.e. if they can determine that the player is trying to bluff). Once the answering player has declared whether they know it, and how many spaces they are playing for, players take turns to say Poppycock! if they do not believe them, or Persuaded! if they do. Starting with the player to the left of the answering player, each player must declare Poppycock! or Persuaded!

If all players are Persuaded!, the answering player will move their declared number of spaces, without having to provide an answer. If any amount of players shout Poppycock!, an answer must be given by the answering player. This answer is checked by the questioner on the reverse of the card. If the answering player was correct, they move forwards their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves backwards that number of spaces. If the answering player was incorrect, they go back their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves forwards the declared number of spaces. When all moves have been resolved, discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player. Proceed in a clockwise direction, with the player to the answering player’s left being the next player to roll the dice and answer a question.

Name: WanderSquares: The Underwood Tunnels
Description:
WanderSquares is a fantasy table-top adventure game for players 9 and up. It features an ever-changing map, a choose-your-path adventure guide and 16 inspiring characters to choose from.


     An Ever-changing Map - The WanderSquares map is made up of 32 interlocking Adventure Squares. Each square is a tiny story; with monsters, puzzles and treasure. The map grows in endless combinations with each new direction the players choose. Three Special Squares contain major magic items (and mini-bosses). Recover the treasure and you'll unlock the final challenge.
     Search for Hidden Treasure - Explore each square to uncover Treasure Cards. You’ll find powerful potions, special weapons, useful gear and magical creatures that will help you in your quest.
     The Adventure Guide - Each square of the map has a matching page in the choose-your-path Adventure Guide that describes the scene and the actions the players can take. Once the players choose an action, turn the page to see what happens next.


—description from the designer

Name: Guyenne
Description:
Guyenne is a card game of bluff, hand management and castle conquest, with a historical flavour.

The name "Guyenne" refers both to the hereditary duchy of the English crown resulting from the Treaty of Brétigny signed in 1360 and to the battle cry of the Anglo-Guyenne armies during the Hundred Years War.

Players compete in successive rounds. They play the cards in their hand to take control of as many of the castle defences as possible that face them. But their forces are limited, and they must be used at the right moment to get the final victory.

Each game turn consists of two phases (laying cards and resolving battles) during which both players are alternately attacker and defender.

—description from the designer

Name: 10 Clues
Description: A trivia game where you get 10 clues to guess the answer.  The player may make one guess per clue to identify the person, place, or thing.  The more clues the player uses, the fewer points they earn (10 points for a correct guess on the first clue, 9 points on the second clue, 8 on the third, and so on).  Players rotate reading the clues and guessing until each player has guessed a few cards (suggested play is 4 cards per each player).  Whoever earns the highest points total wins the game.

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler
Description:
The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler expansion includes:

- 4x miniatures: The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler, 3x Wattle Gobblets
- Over 20 game cards including Wattle Gobbler boss announcements and events.
- Digital PDF Scenario to battle the the Wattle Gobbler

Name: 果てにたゆたい底にただよう (Hate ni tayutai soko ni tadayou)
Vossa Excelência: Calamidade Pública
Description:
The world has plunged into a pandemic. Fear, economic ruin, and death are everywhere. Governments are opening their coffers and implementing emergency measures against the virus. And what does all this mean for Your Excellency?
It's time to make money, A LOT of money.

Vossa Excelência: Expansão Calamidade Pública (Your Excellency: Public Calamity Expansion) is a standalone expansion that can be played alone or in conjunction with Your Excellency – The Political Game and its other expansions. In this expansion, you assume the role of a newly-elected federal deputy who needs to take advantage of the perfect storm of a pandemic to gather support, voters and (lots of) money, thus ensuring his permanence in power.

Can be played alone (for 1 to 3 players) or combined with the other products in the series.

Includes 60 cards:


     3 Politician cards
     3 Party cards
     13 Supporter cards
     16 Maneuvers cards
     7 Event cards
     10 Electorate cards
     8 Infamy cards
     15 money markers
     1 dice
     1 instruction sheet

Name: Parrotdigm
Description: In the trick-taking game Parrotdigm, a new scoring condition is revealed each round, with the points sometimes being positive, sometimes negative. Try to play your hand right to end up on top!

Name: Ambershyft
Description:
Ambershyft is a 2-6 player cooperative game.
This game features a unique enemies turn into resources loot system.


     when you kill blue enemies, you flip their tiles over, and they become ammo.
     when you kill green enemies, they turn into movement.
     when you kill amber colored enemies, they turn into energy.
     when you kill earth colored enemies, they turn into health.


Bounties are how you get upgrades, how enemies spawn, and how enemies become stronger. You must work together to collect bounties before they expire.

—description from the designer

Name: Doktor Snuggles: Kvartettspel
Description: This card game contains eight families with four cards in each family. Each turn a player asks another player if he/she has one particular card. If the other player has that card he/she has to give it away to the one asking for it. Then the player can continue asking for cards. If a player don´t have the card you asking for, the turn go over to the other player. When you have all cards from one family you can put it down in front of you. The goal of the game is to collect as many sets of families as possible. The game is based on the character Doctor Snuggels created by Jeffrey O'Kelly.

Name: Das Expedition Natur Spiel
Description:
Explore nature, actually at any time of year, but best from April to October. Properly dressed and well equipped, take order cards, explorer badges and ink pads. The players form teams and draw three order cards per round. Then they all try to complete their missions quickly and correctly and bring them to headquarters. If they succeed, they get a stamp point in their explorer badge. For each order, you have to present a found object; for orange orders, you have to show or describe exactly where it was found. In case of doubt, the game leader decides. The team that collects eight stamp points first wins.

—user summary

Name: Die bunte Bande
Description:
Own circles should be connected by different colorful shapes.

Each player has four circles of one color - blue, pink, gray and yellow-green. One circle of each player is placed in the center together with the circle of the other players so that these circles touch each other, so to speak, form a square. The remaining circles are laid out in a circle around this center square with about a hand's width between them; there should be space between the circles and circles of the same color should not be directly adjacent or too close together. The 36 shape cards in six colors - yellow, orange, blue, purple, dark green and red - are laid out in an unordered pile, with each shape once per color.

The active player rolls the dice and takes any shape card of that color and places it on the table so that it touches a circle or another already existing shape card. If there is no matching shape card left in the supply, take any card of that color from the table and place it somewhere else. In this way, each player tries to be the first to connect his own circles with shape cards. The player who succeeds first is the immediate winner.

Cheerful, colorful, simple and an enjoyable, loose practice of spatial imagination and use of space; for example, you can put the fish and the starfish mouth to tip, or put the head of the gobbler in the crook of the starfish or mushroom - so you can overcome long distances, or avoid making it too easy for the other players to connect their own circles faster.

Name: Corners of the Earth: Dawn Edition
Description:
2-4 players try to gain points over four rounds of play. This is achieved by playing cards overlapping “Corner” cards on the play area to balance habitats. Players may gain a bonus on their turn when their personal habitat is in majority.

A card is played and a new drawn each turn to gain points on the habitat track. Once a player reaches the 16th point on the track, the round ends. After the fourth round, the player with the greatest score from all rounds is the winner.

The game comes with 60 domino style cards and 5 pawns while fitting in a portable poker tuck box. The original version was published on The Game Crafter in 2020 with different art, packaging, and did not include cards to keep score.

Name: Lingering Hues
Description:
Abner and Hazelponi Hue must stop the Kimriyr before they reach the tombs of Naphal in this game of survival. This is a solo dice game in which victory is achieved by rolling dice to equal an enemies K.O. Points.

Getting past 12 enemies,(fewer for easier difficulty) will ensure victory. This is achieved with the aid of abilities and traits to provide re-rolls. The game includes eye catching dice and plastic flame token for tracking.

On a player's turn, a hand card is played and a new card drawn. With each card played, the enemy movement markers moves a step. When the marker is moved off the last mark, the enemy is encountered. All six dice are rolled in an encounter in an attempt to match the K.O. Value. The game ends when the player loses all capacity points or finished the last encounter with at least one capacity point remaining.

Changes from the 2015 edition include: 
Tthe 16 custom candle dice concept in the 2015 version is removed. The new version has six standard dice and uses three tracking cards.

Movement is no longer tracked by cards, rather tracked with a token.

A main character had 1 ability in the 2015 version while the new version has 8 to purchase and use by playing cards.

Name: Kalandozoo Marci az állatkertben
Description:
In this game you visit the zoo with the class. The teacher aunt gives the task of looking at what animals during the trip. The player in his turn can spend 3 actions to move on a board, observe animals, or buy. Observed animals (collect token) and expected items can score points at the end of the game. After 16 rounds, the zoo closes and the game is over. Whoever collects the most points wins.

In addition to the basic game, the toy box also contains 5 additional modules - The Lost Baby, Animal Feeding, Aunt Teacher, Shower, Bus

Name: Virusalarm in Bleibhausen
Description:
It is a beautiful spring day when two people return from their skiing holiday in the 100-inhabitant town of Bleibhausen. What neither of them know: They contracted the new NOSO virus (STILL SO a virus) while on vacation! Only after three days of incubation do they feel sick and stay at home. But how many residents have the two infected meanwhile unnoticed?
Can a major virus outbreak still be prevented?

Virusalarm in Bleibhausen is a free game for children and adolescents from the age of 12 that was developed with scientists from IST Austria and the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Biology. By reenacting the spread of a fictional virus in a city, players will explore and understand what countermeasures can take to contain viruses. In the Home Edition for the home, the players slip into the role of scientists ( game variants “simulation” and “vaccination ”), or into the role of politicians who have to weigh the advantages and disadvantages of restrictions on public life ( game variant “Challenge ” ).

Chips symbolize people, yellow ones are sick, white ones are still healthy. They are distributed in different buildings on a game board that depicts the fictional city of Bleibhausen. If there are white chips with yellow ones in a building, e.g. the restaurant, they become infected and turn yellow.

Players try to minimise the spread and earn points depending on how well they control the disease.  The player/team with the most points, wins.

Es ist ein schöner Frühlingstag, als im 100-Einwohner Städtchen Bleibhausen zwei Leute vom Skiurlaub zurückkommen. Was die beiden nicht wissen: Sie haben sich im Urlaub mit dem neuen NOSO-Virus (NOch SO ein Virus) angesteckt! Erst nach drei Tagen Inkubationszeit fühlen sie sich krank und bleiben zuhause. Aber wie viele Einwohner_innen haben die beiden inzwischen schon unbemerkt angesteckt?
Ist ein großer Virenausbruch noch zu verhindern?

Name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Dungeons Dark – The Rescue: Part 2
Description:
The quest that began in Across the Wastes continues in Dungeons Dark!

This new mission includes 4 scenarios that use a classic dungeon-style set-up. The rangers must explore the labyrinthine corridors and rooms of the dungeon, fighting monsters, dodging traps, and perhaps even finding a bit of treasure, in their bid to escape the dungeon and continue with their quest. The book also includes an extra scenario, should the rangers get captured, and a section on ‘shadow magic’, which the heroes can employ at their peril.

A Mission for Level 10+ Rangers

Name: Firm With Brownies: Shokai Training!
Description:
This is an expansion set for the Firm with Brownies (basic set) that has been set in the fantasy world. Basic set is required to play This set includes rules for one player game that allows players to become a sharp, merchant player to learn more about their creation, sales and their friends Brownies. Go ahead and start training with Brownies for business meetings. With this product, all additional cards can also be used for basic game sets. Number of players: 1 to 4 players; Play time: 30 minutes and up.

New cards include locations: Trading Post, General Store, Wheat farm, Furniture Shop.  Four "Player Action" cards are included, which can be used to indicate when you've used your main action, making it easier to keep track of your turn.

Name: Rome:  Rising Empires
Description:
"Rome: Rising Empires" This is a Roman themed board game with fun combat and an extensive variety of units to choose from, both on land and sea. There are Coins, Forts, Roads, Unit Tokens, Empire Boards, Trackers, Info Boards, Empire Markers, Generals, Commanders, Engineers, Inventions, Battle Boards and a huge Map with 45 sea zones and 127 land territories for you to wage war on.

The scenario in the game is set before Rome grew into the dominant force (circa 219 BC) and it will be up to you as a Player, to become the largest and most powerful empire in the Mediterranean. The rising empires of Rome, Carthage, Ptolemaic, Seleucid, Antigonid and Germania will go to war and determine who will conquer or fall.

The game can be found on "combatminiatures.org"

Enjoy!

Name: Paul Koenig's The Bulge Deluxe Edition
Description:
Paul Koenig’s The Bulge is a system containing seven separate competitive introductory level wargames covering the German 1944 winter offensive known as “The Battle of the Bulge.” As a special bonus, it also includes the German May 1940 attack upon Sedan against the French army.

This Deluxe Edition is an expansion to Paul Koenig's THE BULGE 6th Panzer Army, first published by VPG. It includes the following scenarios ...

5th Panzer Army - SE section of map
    6th Panzer Army - NE section of map
    7th Army Extension
    â€‹The Combined Game (5 & 6 PZA)
    The Campaign Game - entire map (16 December to 26 December 1944)
    Army Group B 1944 - NW section of map (23 December to 26 December 1944)
    Army group A 1940 - SW section of map (11 May to 15 May 1940)

Each scenario has its own Exclusive Rules while each uses the same Standard Rules.

The design of these games is loosely based upon Paul Koenig’s D-Day and Market Garden series.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Kingdom Dice
Description:
The old king lies dead in a gambling hall, just two gems left in the coffers. Bandits wait on the borders, ready to strike. The farms and mines have fallen silent. You must rebuild the kingdom before the borders fall! All you have left to lose is a pair of dice. Save the failing kingdom you've inherited in this print-and-play roll and write game. You must rebuild the kingdom by constructing new farms and mines, investing in technologies and funding adventures, all before the kingdom inevitably falls again.

Made during the 2020 worldwide Covid-19 quarantine. Print out a few copies and play with the people you're isolating with, or hop on a chat and play a remote game with friends.

—description from the publisher

In this game, you will roll two dice and use their results to mark attacks, production, buildings (farms and mines), technologies, and adventurers in the game sheet.

The game ends when any player marks all the attacks on a single border of the realm or all his/her mines as built. Finish the current round, then tally scores. The player with most victory points wins.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge 2
Description:
You are locked up by a genius, with no hope of release, are you…? He'll let you go if you can prove you're worth it! Show that you can remain calm under pressure. Solve as many puzzles as possible within 10 minutes; only then do you have a chance of surviving this… Play alone or in a team and unravel the riddles under time pressure, while the seconds tick away.

There are 48 riddles to solve, with an encoder included to check your answers.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: WATO (What Are The Odds...)
Description:
The game of What are the Odds where you don't need to think about what scenario of odds to give your friends next.

We're not saying your going of friends is boring, but, we're saying it takes a little bit more effort to create an unforgettable night. So, that's why we've come up with 130 ridiculous scenarios that will embarrass everyone one card a time and you'll find yourself belly laughing on the ground not caring that someone just pee'd there.

The game goes a little something like this:

Person A picks up from the deck and reads the card aloud to everyone "What are the Odds?" Person B (The person to their right aka righty) chooses the odds to make this between. This cannot be any higher than 10 or any lower than 2. The closer to 10, the less chance of the odds being chosen. The closer to 2, the more change of the odds being chosen because yeah...it's a one in two chance.

Person A & B think of a number between those odds set by Person B.  Everyone counts 3,2,1....then at the same time Person A & Person B say the number they were thinking between those odds given.

If they say the same number, then Person B must do the task for the points or risk loosing points. If they don't say the same number, then it moves on to Person B pulling a card and reading it to Person C. (or back to Person A if you are playing with 2 people)

The name of the game is to get the most points and win. You decide on how many points that is as a group before starting.

Name: Backflip!
Description:
This solo game has the shortest rules ever written. The goal of the game is written on the title: Backflip!

During his turn, the player throws the eraser in order to do a backflip with it. If the eraser does a full rotation and it lands showing a smile on the face, he wins. If the player fails to complete a full rotation with the eraser or doesn't land showing a smile on the face, he loses.

Name: UNO: Minions – The Rise of Gru
Description:
UNO with Minions theme, but with a special rule that let's you strike a pose in the game.

There is a card called the Wild Dumb Fu card. If you play it, the next player in line skips their turn. Instead they have to hold a martial art pose until the next time, their turns comes on. If they move before it's their turn, they have to draw 4 cards. It also is a wild card so when you play it, you can choose the color to resume in play.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Woordrace
Description:
Throw 13 dice with different letters on them. Then when the hourglass starts you try to make a crossword of words that give you the most points.

Each letter has a point value.  Total up your points for each word.  the player who has the most points at the end of the game, wins.

Name: Ludnica na tribinama
Description:
Each player is a seating manager making sure his part of the stands is filled with happy spectators. On his turn a player adds a new spectator to his hand, then chooses to place any from his hand on his board. By fulfilling their seating preferences he scores public and private objectives. The game ends when one of the stands is filled. The player with the most points wins.

Name in English: Show on the Stands.

Name: Big-Bobby-Car-Sicher im Verkehr
Description:
Traffic education with Big Bobby Car.

Each character starts in house A or B. The car and road cards are divided into two piles. Everyone tries to get to school or kindergarten as quickly and safely as possible.

The first player answers a question about the traffic cards - if the answer is correct, you roll the dice and move on. You stop on a red field (road crossing!). The road can be crossed in the next turn with "green" of the traffic light dice. Unsecured crossings can only be crossed by revealing a free street. With a crossing guard you cross the street with a 4, 5 or 6.

The first player to reach their destination, wins.

Name: Pana Po'o
Description:
Party game in which you have to guess the concept that your partner tries to capture with the pieces of different shapes that come in the game. A challenge to the imagination.

One player in each team, picks a tile with a concept. Then they roll the die an then try to construct the shape using the same color tiles for their partner to guess before the sand timer runs out.  A successful guess scores a point.  At the end of the third round, the winner is the one who has guessed the most words. and the team with the most points when the tiles are completed, wins.

Name: Würfelschlange
Description:
The game contains 7 different, very simple dice games. It's mostly about achieving certain dice combinations first or with the fewest rolls. Since the individual games are played with up to 13 dice, it is advantageous to recognize combinations or patterns.

—user summary
